requirements.summary: Render the exact headline text prominently at the top/center of the single-page view.
acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, the page shows the exact headline text: "Bytes console winning!"
The headline is visually dominant (large font size and strong emphasis) and clearly readable on desktop and mobile

file_operations.description: Create the single-page App view and render the exact headline text "Bytes console winning!" centered near the top with very large, prominent typography.

requirements.summary: Add a labeled code entry input directly beneath the headline with local state updates.
acceptanceCriteria: A text input is visible beneath the headline
The input has an English label or placeholder indicating it is for entering a code (e.g., "Enter code")
Typing in the input updates the local UI state without errors

file_operations.description: Add a labeled code entry UI directly beneath the headline using shadcn-ui form primitives (e.g., Label and Input) and manage the input value in React local state. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive minimal “console/bytes” visual theme across the page (background, colors, typography, spacing) without a blue/purple primary look.
acceptanceCriteria: The page uses a consistent, intentional theme (not default browser styling)
The theme avoids a blue/purple primary look unless explicitly requested later
Layout remains clean and centered with sensible spacing on common viewport sizes

file_operations.description: Create global styles/theme tokens (CSS variables used by Tailwind/shadcn) and base element styling to establish a minimal console/bytes look (dark/neutral background, high-contrast foreground, consistent spacing/typography) and ensure the page is centered and responsive.

Adjust Tailwind theme extensions if needed to support the console/bytes styling (e.g., font family choices or additional neutral accent colors) while keeping the overall palette away from blue/purple.
Apply layout and Tailwind utility classes to keep the headline and code input consistently themed, centered, and spaced appropriately across viewport sizes.
